org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin
Class AutowiringApplicationServlet

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          com.vaadin.terminal.gwt.server.AbstractApplicationServlet
              com.vaadin.terminal.gwt.server.ApplicationServlet
                  org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin.AutowiringApplicationServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig
public class AutowiringApplicationServlet
extends ApplicationServlet

ApplicationServlet that autowires and configures the Application objects it creates using the associated Spring WebApplicationContext. This allows a Vaadin application to be configured normally as a Spring bean.

For example, annotations such as @Autowired, @Required, etc. and interfaces such as BeanFactoryAware, etc. will work on your Application instances.

An example of "direct" use of this servlet in conjunction with Spring's ContextLoaderListener: 

  <!-- Spring context loader -->
  <listener>
      <listener-class>org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoaderListener</listener-class>
  </listener>

  <!-- Vaadin servlet -->
  <servlet>
      <servlet-name>myapp</servlet-name>
      <servlet-class>com.example.AutowiringApplicationServlet</servlet-class>
      <init-param>
          <param-name>application</param-name>
          <param-value>some.spring.configured.Application</param-value>
      </init-param>
      <init-param>
          <param-name>productionMode</param-name>
          <param-value>true</param-value>
      </init-param>
  </servlet>
  <servlet-mapping>
      <servlet-name>myapp</servlet-name>
      <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>

An example that creates a Spring MVC "controller" bean for use with Spring's DispatcherServlet: 

  <!-- Activate Spring annotation support -->
  <context:annotation-config/>

  <!-- Define controller bean for Vaadin application -->
  <bean id="applicationController" class="org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.ServletWrappingController"
     p:servletClass="com.example.AutowiringApplicationServlet">
      <property name="initParameters">
          <props>
              <prop key="application">some.spring.configured.Application</prop>
              <prop key="productionMode">true</prop>
          </props>
      </property>
  </bean>

See Also:
ContextLoaderListener, DispatcherServlet, ServletWrappingController, AutowireCapableBeanFactory, Serialized Form

getAutowireCapableBeanFactory

protected final AutowireCapableBeanFactory getAutowireCapableBeanFactory()
                                                                  throws ServletException
Get the AutowireCapableBeanFactory associated with the containing Spring WebApplicationContext. This only works after the servlet has been initialized (via init()).

Throws:
ServletException - if the operation fails

getNewApplication

protected Application getNewApplication(HttpServletRequest request)
                                 throws ServletException
Create and configure a new instance of the configured application class.

The implementation in AutowiringApplicationServlet delegates to getAutowireCapableBeanFactory(), then invokes AutowireCapableBeanFactory.createBean() using the configured Application class.

Overrides:
getNewApplication in class ApplicationServlet
Parameters:
request - the triggering HttpServletRequest
Throws:
ServletException - if creation or autowiring fails
